ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This grad course was a great way for me, an undergrad, to explore computer science research and read some very interesting papers about new work in the field.
Learned about a broad range of topics in machine learning (particularly deep learning).
I learned about many different topics in machine learning, especially in deep learning.
the latest knowledge about deep learning.

Seminar format was great for deep learning, which is a rapidly advancing field. Getting to have lively discussion with current applied math PhD students was very helpful. In particular, discussions around deep networks and generalization were very clarifying.
I gained knowledge in a diverse range of topics related to the quickly advancing field of machine learning.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: The course is very shaped by its students and their interests, so we spoke about a range of research topics during the semester which I found to be particularly memorable. Weaknesses: The class is pretty unstructured, which can be difficult at times to ascertain how well I'm doing in the class.
Interactive format is good. Would have been better held in a small meeting room to encourage discussion.
It's very relaxed and student-run. I was very satisfied with the course.

I thought the reading, presentation and discussion format was quite good. My one suggestion would be to have a smaller set of readings for each class and have everyone read each reading instead of having a selection of readings to choose from. I think this would have lead to more productive discussions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you're interested in research and don't really want to do more problem sets, this is a great low-workload class for the Computer Science and Applied Math majors that discusses interesting material.

Yes. This is a very good way of learning about a wide range of topics in deep learning and encouraging critical thought about the current dogma. Also the interactive format meant I got to know more of my peers than I otherwise would have.
Yes, if that student wanted an introduction into a wide range of current machine learning topics.
